intro: Calyptranthes pullei var. immaculata, commonly known as the white-flowered calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are white to pale pink, with five petals and numerous stamens, and it produces small, woody fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland habitats.
